title: Eligibility
introduction: Probate gives you the legal right to deal with a person’s property, money and possessions (their ‘estate’) after they’ve died.
paragraph1: You need to fill in the application online then send your documents to the probate registry. We’ll tell you exactly what you need to send when you have completed your application.
paragraph2:
You can apply in Welsh by post.
Use form PA1P (opens in a new window) if the person who died left a will, and form PA1A (opens in a new window) if there is no will.
multipleHeader: If more than one person is applying
paragraph3: Up to 4 people can apply for probate.
paragraph4: All applicants will need to agree with the legal declaration and their names will appear on the grant of probate.
paragraph5: Everyone applying must have their own email address. That’s because we can’t discuss details with anyone but the people named in the application.
paragraph6: They will also need a mobile phone and access to the Internet.
paragraph7old: It costs £215 to apply for probate if the value of the estate is more than £5,000. It’s free if the value is less.
paragraph7: The application fee is based on the value of the estate. There’s no fee if the estate is £50,000 or under.
paragraph8old: Extra copies of the grant of probate cost £1.50 each.
paragraph8: Extra copies of the grant of probate cost £10 for the first copy and 50 pence for every copy after that.
paragraph9: You’ll need to pay online by debit or credit card.
paragraph10: We’re currently building this service. If you notice things that don’t work as well as they should, you can use the ‘feedback’ link at the top of the page.
